types.name: Query
types.description:
Queries are used to retrieve data. If you're new to our API,
try the `me` query to explore the information you have access to.
Hit `ctrl-space` at any time to activate field completion hints, and
mouse over a field or parameter to see its documentation.

fields.name: temporalDataObjects
fields.description: Retrieve a list of temporal data objects.

args.name: applicationId
args.description: Application ID to get TDOs for. Defaults to the user's own application.

args.name: id
args.description: Provide an ID to retrieve a single specific TDO.

args.name: offset
args.description: Provide an offset to skip to a certain element in the result, for paging.

args.name: limit
args.description: Specify maximum number of results to retrieve in this result. Page size.

args.name: sourceId
args.description:
Optionally, specify a source ID. TDOs ingested from this source will
be returned.

args.name: scheduledJobId
args.description:
Optionally, specify a scheduled job ID. TDOs ingested under this
scheduled job will be returned.

args.name: sampleMedia
args.description: Whether to retrieve only tdos with the specified sampleMedia value

args.name: includePublic
args.description:
Whether to retrieve public data that is not part of the user's organization.
The default is false. Pass true to include public data in the result set.

args.name: dateTimeFilter
args.description:
Provide optional filters against any date/time field to filter
objects within a given time window.
Matching objects must meet all of the given conditions.

args.name: mentionId
args.description: Retrieve TDOs associated with the given mention

Returns information about the GraphQL server, useful
for diagnostics. This data is primarily used by Veritone

fields.name: getSignedWritableUrl
fields.description:
Returns a signed writable S3 URL. A client can then
upload to this URL with an HTTP PUT without providing
any additional authorization (_note_: it must be a PUT.
A POST will fail.)

args.name: key
args.description:
Optional key of the object to generate a writable
URL for. If not provided, a new, unique key will
be generated. If a key is provided and resembles a file name
(with extension delimited by .), a UUID will be inserted
into the file name, leaving the extension intact.
If a key is provided and does not resemble
a file name, a UUID will be appended.

fields.name: getSignedWritableUrls
fields.description:
Return writable storage URLs in bulk.
A maximum of 1000 can be created in one call.
See `getSignedWritableUrl` for details on usage of the
response contents.

args.name: number
args.description: Number of signed URLs to return

args.name: dateTimeFilter
args.description:
Specify date/time filters against mention fields.
Querying for mentions can be expensive. If the query does not
include a filter by `id`, `tdoId`, `sourceId`, `watchlistId`, or
a user-provided `dateTimeFilter`, a default filter of the
past 7 days is applied.

args.name: orderBy
args.description:
Set order information on the query. Multiple fields
are supported.

fields.name: engineResults
fields.description: Retrieves engine results by TDO and engine ID or by job ID.

args.name: tdoId
args.description:
Provide the ID of the TDO containing engine results to retrieve.
If this parameter is used, engineIds or engineCategoryIds must also be set.
Results for _only_ the specified TDO will be returned.

args.name: sourceId
args.description:
Provide the ID of the Source containing engine results to retrieve.
If this parameter is used, engineIds or engineCategoryIds must also be set.
This takes priority over tdoId.

args.name: engineIds
args.description:
Provide one or more engine IDs to retrieve engine results by
ID. This parameter is mandatory if tdoId is used, but optional
if jobId or engineCategory is used.

args.name: engineCategoryIds
args.description: Provide one or more category IDs to get all results from that categroy.

args.name: jobId
args.description: Provide a job ID to retrieve engine results for the job.

args.name: mentionId
args.description: Provide a mention ID to retrieve engine results for the mention.

args.name: startOffsetMs
args.description: Start offset ms for the results.

args.name: stopOffsetMs
args.description: End offset ms for the results.

args.name: startDate
args.description: Start date for the results. Takes priority over startOffsetMs.

args.name: stopDate
args.description: End date for the results. Takes priority over stopOffsetMs.

args.name: ignoreUserEdited
args.description: Whether or not to exclude user edited engine results. Defaults to false.

args.name: fallbackTdoId
args.description:
A TDO ID can be provided for use if the provided `sourceId` and/or
`mentionId` parameters do not resolve to a logical set of TDOs.
Depending on parameter settings and available data,
results from other TDOs can be included in the response.

fields.name: auditLog
fields.description:
Examine entries from the audit log. All operations that modify data are
written to the audit log. Only entries for the user's own organization
can be queried.
All queries are bracketed by a time window. A default time window is applied
if the `toDateTime` and/or `fromDateTime` parameters are not provided.
The maximum time window length is 30 days.
Only Veritone and organization administrators can use this query.

args.name: toDateTime
args.description:
Date/time up to which entries will be returned. In other words, the
end of the query time window.
Defaults to the current time.

args.name: fromDateTime
args.description:
Date/time from which entries will be returned. In other words, the
start of the query time window.
Defaults to the `toDateTime` minus 7 days.

args.name: organizationId
args.description:
Organization ID to query records for. This value can only be used by
Veritone administrators. Any value provided by user administrators will
be ignored.

args.name: userName
args.description: User name on audit entry. Must be exact match.

args.name: clientIpAddress
args.description: IP address of the client that generated the audit action. Must be exact match.

args.name: clientUserAgent
args.description: HTTP user agent of the client that generated the audit action. Must be exact match.

args.name: eventType
args.description:
The event type, such as `Create`, `Update`, or `Delete`.
Must be exact match.

args.name: objectId
args.description:
The ID of the object involved in the audit action. The format of this ID
varies by object type. Must be exact match.

args.name: objectType
args.description:
The type of the object involved in the audit action, such as `Watchlist`
or `TemporalDataObject`. Must be exact match.

args.name: success
args.description: Whether or not the action was successful.

args.name: id
args.description: The unique ID of an audit log entry. Multiple values can be provided.

args.name: offset
args.description: Offset into result set, for paging.

args.name: limit
args.description:
Limit on result size, for paging (page size). Audit queries are
lightweight so the default of 100 is higher than the default offset
used elsewhere in the API.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Order information. Default is order by `createdDateTime` descending.

types.name: DeploymentModel
types.description:
Deployment models describe how an engine or application operates on the network
and where the data it works with is transmitted. See Veritone's developer
documentation at https://steel-ventures.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/VDH/pages/101364981/Engine+Deployment+Models
for a full description.

enumValues.name: FullyNetworkIsolated
enumValues.description:
The engine or application is fully isolated and does not call out to any
external endpoints. Numerical code 0.

enumValues.name: MostlyNetworkIsolated
enumValues.description:
The engine or application does not transmit data about its payload over the internet,
but may still make external network calls for limited purposes. Numerical code 1.

enumValues.name: NonNetworkIsolated
enumValues.description:
The engine or application is not network isolated and must call out to external services
and transmit data about its payload. Numerical code 2.

enumValues.name: HumanReview
enumValues.description: Human review of engine results is required. Numerical code 3.

enumValues.description: The application is in draft state during test and development

enumValues.name: deleted
enumValues.description: The application has been deleted and is no longer available for any purpose

enumValues.name: pending
enumValues.description: The application is awaiting approval.

enumValues.name: rejected
enumValues.description: The application has been rejected and must be modified and re-submitted.

enumValues.name: approved
enumValues.description: The application has been approved and can now be deployed.

enumValues.name: disabled
enumValues.description: The application has been disabled, but not deleted.

types.name: EngineState
types.description: Enumeration containing the set of allowed values for the Engine state field.

enumValues.name: active
enumValues.description: The engine is deployed and active. Set the state to this value to deploy it.

enumValues.name: disabled
enumValues.description: The engine has been disabled. Set this state to disable the engine.

enumValues.name: pending
enumValues.description: The engine is awaiting approval before transitioning to the next state.

enumValues.name: deleted
enumValues.description: The engine has been deleted and is no longer available for use.

enumValues.name: draft
enumValues.description: The engine is in draft state, suitable for review and internal testing.

enumValues.name: ready
enumValues.description: The engine is ready for deployment, but has not been deployed yet.

types.name: BuildStatus
types.description: Valid strings for the `Build.status` field.

enumValues.name: approved
enumValues.description: The build has been approved and is ready for deployment

enumValues.name: available
enumValues.description: The build is available for deployment

enumValues.name: deleted
enumValues.description: The build has been soft-deleted.

enumValues.name: deploying
enumValues.description: The build is being deployed.

enumValues.name: deployed
enumValues.description: The build has been deployed. There can be only one deployed build.

enumValues.name: fetching
enumValues.description: The build files are being fetched from their source.

enumValues.name: invalid
enumValues.description: The build failed validation checks. See build report for details.

enumValues.name: paused
enumValues.description:
The build is deployed but has been paused. Engine processing will not
proceed until the build is un-paused.

enumValues.name: pending
enumValues.description:
The build has been created but is still pending approval and other
workflow steps.

enumValues.name: uploaded
enumValues.description: The build has been successfully uploaded to the build repository.

enumValues.name: deployFailed
enumValues.description: Deployment has failed

fields.description: Maximum value, in float format. Applies only to fields of type Number.

fields.name: min
fields.description: Minimum value, in float format. Applies only to fields of type Number.

fields.name: step
fields.description:
Numerical step by which the value should be incremented or decremented in
the user interface, in float format. Applies only to fields of type Number.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The field type.

fields.name: info
fields.description: General information about the field, such as a description.

fields.name: name
fields.description: A machine-readable name, or key, for the field.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A human-readable label for the field.

fields.name: options
fields.description:
A set of allowed values for the field. Applies only to fields of type
picklist or multi-picklist.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description:
An optional default value for the field. Taken in string format, but
applies to all field types.

fields.name: defaultValues
fields.description:
Optional default values to apply to a picklist. This field
should only be set for a field of type multi-picklist.

types.name: EngineFieldType
types.description: An enum containing valid custom engine field types.

enumValues.name: Number
enumValues.description: A number, in float format

enumValues.name: Picklist
enumValues.description: A pick list that allows the user to choose one of a set of allowed values.

enumValues.name: MultiPicklist
enumValues.description: A pick list that allows the user to choose any number of a set of allowed values.

enumValues.name: Text
enumValues.description: A plain text field

enumValues.name: SchemaSelection
enumValues.description: A dynamic list of schemas that will be populated by the client

types.name: EngineFieldPicklistOption
types.description: Represents one allowed option in a picklist.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The human-readable label for the option, such as "English-US" for a language selector.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
The machine-readable value that will be sent in the engine payload, such as
"en-us" for a language selector.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: URI to the task log file

fields.name: text
fields.description: The entire text contents of the log file. Note that this value can long.

fields.name: jsondata
fields.description:
The log file in JSON form. If the log file contains valid JSON,
this field will contain the native structure. If the log file does not
contain valid JSON, this field will contain a single property called
`text` with a string value containing the entire log file.

enumValues.description: The cause of the failure could not be determined.

enumValues.name: url_not_found
enumValues.description:
The engine attempted to download
content from a URL provided in the task payload and
received a 404.

enumValues.name: url_not_allowed
enumValues.description:
The engine attempted to download
content from a URL provided in the task payload and
received a 401 or 403.

enumValues.name: url_timeout
enumValues.description:
The engine attempted to download
content from a URL provided in the task payload and
the download timed out

enumValues.name: url_connection_refused
enumValues.description:
The engine attempted to download
content from a URL provided in the task payload and
the connection was refused.

enumValues.name: url_error
enumValues.description:
The engine attempted to download content from a URL
provided in the task payload an received an error.

enumValues.name: invalid_data
enumValues.description:
The input to the engine was incompatible with the engine
requirements. For example, an input media file had an
unsupported MIME type or the file was empty.

enumValues.name: rate_limited
enumValues.description: An engine operation was subject to rate limiting.

enumValues.name: api_not_allowed
enumValues.description: The engine received an authorization error from the Veritone API.

enumValues.name: api_authentication_error
enumValues.description:
The engine received an authentication error from the Veritone API using
the token provided in the task payload.

enumValues.name: api_not_found
enumValues.description:
The engine received a "not found" error from the Veritone API on
a required object.

enumValues.name: api_error
enumValues.description:
An unexpected error was received from the Veritone API, such as
HTTP 500, HTTP 502, or an `internal_error` error.

enumValues.name: file_write_error
enumValues.description:
The engine could not write temporary files to disk for processing
due to disk space full or other system error.

enumValues.name: system_dependency_missing
enumValues.description:
The engine encountered a missing binary dependency or configuration,
such as a missing executable or package or incompatible hardware.

enumValues.name: system_error
enumValues.description:
The engine encountered an operating system, hardware, or other
system-level error.

enumValues.name: other
enumValues.description:
The error cause is known, but could not be mapped to a `TaskFailureReason`
value. The `failureMessage` input field should contain details.

types.description:
Mutations are used to modify data. Each mutation takes an input
that contains the data necessary to create or update the data
in question.

fields.name: createTDO
fields.description: Create a new temporal data object

args.description: Fields required to create a TDO

fields.description: Update a temporal data object

args.name: input
args.description: Fields required to update a TDO

fields.name: deleteTDO
fields.description:
Delete a temporal data object. The TDO metadata, its assets and
all storage objects, and search index data are deleted.
Engine results stored in related task objects are not.
cleanupTDO can be used to selectively delete certain data on the TDO.

args.name: id
args.description: Supply the ID of the TDO to delete

fields.name: cleanupTDO
fields.description:
Delete partial information from a temporal data object.
Use the delete options to control exactly which data is deleted.
The default is to delete objects from storage and the search index,
while leaving TDO-level metadata and task engine results intact.
To permanently delete the TDO, use delete TDO.

args.name: id
args.description: Supply the ID of the TDO to clean up.

args.name: options
args.description:
Supply a list of cleanup options. See TDOCleanupOption
for details. If not provided, the server will use default settings.

fields.name: userLogin
fields.description:
Login as a user. This mutation does not require an existing authentication
context (via `Authorization` header with bearer token, cookie, etc.).
Instead, the client supplies credentials to this mutation, which then
authenticates the user and sets up the authentication context.
The returned tokens can be used to authenticate future requests.

fields.name: refreshToken
fields.description:
Refresh a user token, returning a fresh token so that the client
can continue to authenticate to the API.

fields.name: validateToken
fields.description:
Validate a user token. This mutation is used by services to determine
if the token provided by a given client is valid.

fields.name: fileTemporalDataObject
fields.description:
File a TemporalDataObject in a folder. A given TemporalDataObject can
be filed in any number of folders, or none. Filing causes the TemporalDataObject
and its assets to be visible within the folder.

args.name: input
args.description: The fields needed to file a TemporalDataObject in a folder

fields.name: unfileTemporalDataObject
fields.description:
Unfile a TemporalDataObject from a folder. This causes the TemporalDataObject
and its assets to disappear from the folder, but does not otherwise affect
either the TDO or the folder and does not change access controls.

args.name: input
args.description: The fields needed to file a TemporalDataObject in a folder

Any other folders the TemporalDataObject is filed in are unaffected.

types.name: CreateTDO
types.description: Payload required to create a temporal data object

inputFields.name: startDateTime
inputFields.description: Start date and time in numerical (epoch) format.

inputFields.name: stopDateTime
inputFields.description: Stop date and time in numerical (epoch) format.

inputFields.name: source
inputFields.description: Source for the TDO, such as an ingestion type or engine ID.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description:
Status, such as "downloaded" or "recording".
The server will set a value if one is not provided.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: A name for the TDO object, such as the name of the primary media file.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: A description for the TDO object.

inputFields.name: isPublic
inputFields.description:
True if the new TDO should be made public. If true, security.global
will be set to true and users from other organizations will be able to
view, but not modify, the TDO's metadata and assets.

inputFields.name: parentFolderId
inputFields.description:
An optional parent folder ID for the new TemporalDataObject.
The folder can be filed in additional folders later using `fileTemporalDataObject`,
or un-filed from this one.

inputFields.name: sourceData
inputFields.description:
Optionally, set source data for this TDO. Source data identifies
that task that generated this TDO. If the TDO was not generated as part
of engine or adapter execution, this field should not be set.
However, it is _strongly_ recommended that engines that create TDOs
set this field. Doing so ensures that later tasks in the same job
have appropriate access to the new TDO.

inputFields.name: applicationId
inputFields.description: Only internal systems can set this value

inputFields.name: contentTemplates
inputFields.description:
Optionally, specify one or more structured data objects to apply as
content templates to the TDO. They will be stored as assets of type
content-template and will contain an immutable copy of the original data.

inputFields.name: addToIndex
inputFields.description:
Optionally, add the new data to the search index. If the data is not
indexed on creation, it can be indexed later by using `updateTDO` or
creating a suitable job.

inputFields.name: thumbnailUrl
inputFields.description: An optional thumbnail URL for the TDO

inputFields.name: previewUrl
inputFields.description: An optional preview asset URL for the TDO

inputFields.name: sourceImageUrl
inputFields.description: An optional image representing the TDO source

types.name: SetTDOSourceData
types.description: Identifies the task that created a TDO.

inputFields.name: taskId
inputFields.description: ID of the task that created this TDO

inputFields.name: sourceId
inputFields.description:
Optional ID of the source from which this TDO's initial
data was created. This field will typically be set only
by adapters that ingest data and create TDOs.

inputFields.name: scheduledJobId
inputFields.description: Optional ID of the scheduled job that created this TDO.

inputFields.name: schemaId
inputFields.description:
Supply the ID of the data registry that contains the schema
for the content template.

inputFields.name: sdoId
inputFields.description:
To associate an existing structured data object (SDO) to the
TDO, provide the SDO ID. Either this field or data must be supplied.

inputFields.name: data
inputFields.description:
To create a new structured data object, supply this field with
JSON to save in the SDO. The JSON must comply with the schema
defined in data registry.

types.name: UpdateTDO
types.description: Payload required to create a temporal data object

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the TDO to update

inputFields.name: startDateTime
inputFields.description: Start date and time in numerical (epoch) format.

inputFields.name: stopDateTime
inputFields.description: Stop date and time in numerical (epoch) format.

inputFields.name: source
inputFields.description: Source for the TDO, such as an ingestion type or engine ID.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: Current status, such as "downloaded" or "recording".

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: A name for the TDO object, such as the name of the primary media file.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: A description for the TDO object.

inputFields.name: primaryAsset
inputFields.description: Set the primary asset of a given type (transcript or media)

inputFields.name: isPublic
inputFields.description:
True if the new TDO should be made public. If true, security.global
will be set to true and users from other organizations will be able to
view, but not modify, the TDO's metadata and assets.

inputFields.name: contentTemplates
inputFields.description:
Optionally, specify one or more structured data objects to apply as
content templates to the TDO. They will be stored as assets of type
content-template and will contain an immutable copy of the original data.
Setting this field on an update does _not_ affect any content templates
previously added to the TDO -- it only creates the new ones.

inputFields.name: thumbnailUrl
inputFields.description: An optional thumbnail URL for the TDO

inputFields.name: previewUrl
inputFields.description: An optional preview asset URL for the TDO

inputFields.name: sourceImageUrl
inputFields.description: An optional image representing the TDO source

types.name: SetPrimaryAsset
types.description:
Input used to set the primary asset of a given type on a TDO.
The type must be supported by the server; primary asset is used
by certain engines and front end components.
Currently "media" and "transcript" are supported.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the asset

inputFields.name: assetType
inputFields.description: The asset type -- "media" or "transcript"

types.description: Payload required to delete an object

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the object that was deleted

fields.name: message
fields.description: a message

types.name: TDOCleanupOption
types.description: Options used by the cleanupTDO mutation to select which data is deleted.

enumValues.name: storage
enumValues.description:
Indicates that all assets should be deleted from storage, including
those used to store engine results. Metadata about the assets will remain
until the container TemporalDataObject is permanently deleted.

enumValues.name: searchIndex
enumValues.description:
Indicates that all search index data should be deleted. The TemporalDataObject
and its assets will no longer be accessible through search.

enumValues.name: engineResults
enumValues.description:
Indicates that engine results stored on related task objects should be deleted.
Engine results stored as assets will remain until assets are removed
using the storage option.

inputFields.name: taskId
inputFields.description: ID of the task which the task long belongs to.

inputFields.name: file
inputFields.description: A file to upload. Use multipart form POST to submit this field.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: File or other name

inputFields.name: setAsPrimary

if true, sets the new asset to be the primary asset of its type.
Only certain asset types, such as "media" and "transcript",

inputFields.name: isUserEdited

Set to true if the container stopDateTime needs to be updated by

types.name: CreateEngine
types.description: Input fields used to create a new engine.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Optional given id

inputFields.name: isPublic
inputFields.description:
Indicates whether or not the engine should be public -- visible to and
usable by users outside the creator's organization.
Typically an engine should not be made public until it has been fully
configured and tested in production.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Human-readable name for the engine

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: An optional description for the engine.

inputFields.name: categoryId
inputFields.description: The engine category

inputFields.name: deploymentModel
inputFields.description: The engine deployment model. See the DeploymentModel enum for options.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: An optional price indicator for the engine.

inputFields.name: fields
inputFields.description:
Optionally, supply custom fields that the user can set when launching
the engine. See developer documentation for details.

inputFields.name: iconPath
inputFields.description: The path for an icon image

inputFields.name: logoPath
inputFields.description: The path for a logo image

inputFields.name: libraryRequired
inputFields.description: Whether or not the engine requires a library.

inputFields.name: createsTDO
inputFields.description: Whether or not the engine creates a TDO

inputFields.name: max
inputFields.description: Maximum value, in float format. Applies only to fields of type Number.

inputFields.name: min
inputFields.description: Minimum value, in float format. Applies only to fields of type Number.

inputFields.name: step
inputFields.description:
Numerical step by which the value should be incremented or decremented in
the user interface, in float format. Applies only to fields of type Number.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The field type.

inputFields.name: info
inputFields.description: General information about the field, such as a description.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: A machine-readable name, or key, for the field.

inputFields.name: label
inputFields.description: A human-readable label for the field.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description:
A set of allowed values for the field. Applies only to fields of type
picklist or multi-picklist.

inputFields.name: defaultValue
inputFields.description:
An optional default value for the field. Taken in string format, but
applies to all field types.

inputFields.name: defaultValues
inputFields.description:
Optional default values to apply to a picklist. This field
should only be set for a field of type multi-picklist.

types.name: CreateEngineFieldPicklistOption
types.description: Represents one allowed option in a picklist.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: The human-readable label for the option, such as "English-US" for a language selector.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description:
The machine-readable value that will be sent in the engine payload, such as
"en-us" for a language selector.

types.name: UpdateEngine
types.description: Input fields used to update an existing engine.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Supply the ID of the engine to update

inputFields.name: isPublic
inputFields.description:
Indicates whether or not the engine should be public -- visible to and
usable by users outside the creator's organization.
Typically an engine should not be made public until it has been fully
configured and tested in production.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description:
Human-readable name for the engine. Changing this value will change
how the engine appears to users.

inputFields.name: deploymentModel
inputFields.description: The engine deployment model. See the DeploymentModel enum for options.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: An optional price indicator for the engine.

inputFields.name: fields
inputFields.description:
Optionally, supply custom fields that the user can set when launching
the engine. See developer documentation for details. To update the fields,
make sure you supply the complete set of new fields -- new fields,
updated existing fields, and unmodified existing fields.

inputFields.name: iconPath
inputFields.description: The path for an icon image

inputFields.name: logoPath
inputFields.description: The path for a logo image

inputFields.name: libraryRequired
inputFields.description: Whether or not the engine requires a library.

inputFields.name: outputString
inputFields.description: Task output as JSON string

inputFields.name: outputJsonKey
taskOutput
inputFields.description: Backwards compatibility only

inputFields.name: payload
inputFields.description: Update the task with a new payload

inputFields.name: executionLocationData
inputFields.description: Save execution location metadata

inputFields.name: clientTimestamp
inputFields.description:
Optional timestamp used to control change ordering.
The client may set this to the `modifiedDateTime` value
of most recent copy of the task it has before making the
update. The server will _only_ update the task with the
requested changes _if_ and only if the current
`modifiedDateTime` value is equal to or earlier than
the supplied `clientTimestamp` value. Thus, changes
that were made after the client last retrieved the task
data will not be overwritten.

inputFields.name: failureReason
inputFields.description:
A code indicating why the task failed. Should be set
if and only if task status is `failed`.
If set with any other task status, the API will return an error.

inputFields.name: failureMessage
inputFields.description:
A human-readable string with detail on the
task failure reason. Should be set if and only if
task status is `failed` and `failureReason` is set.
If set with any other task status or if `failureReason` is not set,
the API will return an error.

inputFields.name: scheduledJobId
inputFields.description:
Optionally, specify the scheduled job ID that this job is associated
with. Typically it is not necessary for a client to set this; it is
handled internally by the API.

inputFields.name: jobTemplateId
inputFields.description:
Supply a job template ID to indicate that this
job was created from the given job template.
To create a job _from_ a template, use `launchJobTemplates`.

inputFields.name: clusterId
inputFields.description:
Optionally, specify a cluster ID where the job should run.
Both the organization and the engine must have access to the cluster.

inputFields.name: jobConfig
inputFields.description:
Optional job config information. Typically used only by Veritone
platform components.

types.name: CreateTask

inputFields.description:
The task type, which is mapped on the server to an engine ID.

inputFields.name: engineId

Engine ID to be used for the task.

inputFields.description:
Task payload in raw string form.

inputFields.name: payload
inputFields.description:
Task payload in GraphQL format.
Optional. Only one of payloadString and payload is permitted.

inputFields.name: isClone
inputFields.description: Optional. Specifies whether or not the task target should be cloned.

inputFields.name: buildId
inputFields.description: Optional. Specifies the build ID of the engine

inputFields.name: testTask
inputFields.description: Optional. Specifies whether the task is for testing.

inputFields.name: standbyTask
inputFields.description:
Optionally, provide a task definition that will be executed if
and only if this one fails. Standby tasks can be nested.

inputFields.name: ids

inputFields.description:
If the entity identifier type is image, the new file can automatically
be set on the entity as its profile image. This is off by default
(the entity profile image is not modified) but can be controlled
with this parameter.

types.name: SetEntityProfileImage
types.description:
Settings that determine when to set a new entity identifier
as the entity profile image.

enumValues.name: none
enumValues.description: Do not update the entity profile image

enumValues.name: ifNotSet
enumValues.description:
Set the the entity identifier URL as the entity profile image
only if there is no current profile image. Will cause an error
if the entity identifier type is not an image.

enumValues.name: always
enumValues.description:
Set the entity identifier as the new entity profile image,
overwriting whatever value is present. Will cause an error
if the entity identifier type is not an image.

inputFields.description:
A string containing the engine result.
Use either this field, `output`, `uri`, or `file` with multipart form POST, but not
more than one.

inputFields.description:
JSON data containing the engine result.
A string containing the engine result.
Use either this field, `outputString`, `uri`, or `file` with multipart form POST, but not
more than one.

inputFields.name: file
inputFields.description:
A file to upload. Use multipart form POST to submit this field.
Use this field, the `output`, `outputString`, or `uri` field, not more than one.

inputFields.name: uri
inputFields.description: A URI to the file. Use one and only one of `uri`, `file`, or `output`/`outputString`.

inputFields.name: filename
inputFields.description: The file name

inputFields.name: assetType
inputFields.description:
The type of asset to create. Optional -- if not set, it will be
deduced from the engine category.

inputFields.name: contentType
inputFields.description:
The content type of the file. Optional -- if not set, it will
be deduced from the file name.

inputFields.name: completeTask
inputFields.description: Whether or not to mark the task as complete. Defaults to true.

inputFields.name: outputJsonKey
inputFields.description:
If the result data uploaded is not a valid JSON string, then
the task output data stored on the task object will be wrapped into
a JSON object using this key. The asset created, however, is not
modified in any way.

inputFields.name: fileData
inputFields.description: Optionally, set attributes about the file

inputFields.name: setAsPrimary
inputFields.description:
if true, sets the new asset to be the primary asset of its type.
Only certain asset types, such as "media" and "transcript",
can have primary assets.

inputFields.name: skipIndexing
inputFields.description:
Skips indexing the engine result, preventing mentions from being
generated over the results.

inputFields.name: setTaskOutput
inputFields.description:
Whether or not to set the legacy `task_output` data for compatible
with older clients.

inputFields.name: startDateTime
inputFields.description:
Date and time at which the watchlist becomes effective.
If not provided, defaults to current time.

inputFields.name: stopDateTime
inputFields.description: Date and time at which the watchlist expires and is no longer effective.

inputFields.name: parentFolderId

inputFields.description:

The data is subject to a set of schemas.

inputFields.description: String with JSON containing the cognitive search profiles

inputFields.description:
True if the new TDO should be made public. If true, security.global
will be set to true and users from other organizations will be able to
view, but not modify, the TDO's metadata and assets.

inputFields.name: parentFolderId
inputFields.description:
An optional parent folder ID for the new TemporalDataObject.
The folder can be filed in additional folders later using `fileTemporalDataObject`,
or un-filed from this one.

inputFields.name: assetType
inputFields.description: Asset type. Default is "media".

inputFields.name: sourceData
inputFields.description:
Optionally, set source data for this TDO. Source data identifies
that task that generated this TDO. If the TDO was not generated as part
of engine or adapter execution, this field should not be set.
However, it is _strongly_ recommended that engines that create TDOs
set this field. Doing so ensures that later tasks in the same job
have appropriate access to the new TDO.
This source data will be set on both the TDO and the asset.

inputFields.name: contentTemplates
inputFields.description:
Optionally, specify one or more structured data objects to apply as
content templates to the TDO. They will be stored as assets of type
content-template and will contain an immutable copy of the original data.

inputFields.name: addToIndex
inputFields.description:
Optionally, add the new data to the search index. If the data is not
indexed on creation, it can be indexed later by using `updateTDO` or
creating a suitable job.

inputFields.name: thumbnailUrl
inputFields.description: An optional thumbnail URL for the TDO

inputFields.name: previewUrl
inputFields.description: An optional preview asset URL for the TDO

inputFields.name: sourceImageUrl
inputFields.description: An optional image representing the TDO source

inputFields.name: targetId
inputFields.description: ID of the object (probably a watchlist) to create a subscription for

inputFields.name: events
inputFields.description:
List of events in csv form. Use "*" to listen to all events. When using a wild card, csv form is no longer valid.
 Either events or types can be specified at a time. Example:

 events: "event1,event2,event3" // valid

 events: "*" // valid

 events: "*,event1" // invalid

inputFields.name: types
inputFields.description:
List of events in csv form. Use "*" to listen to all types. When using a wild card, csv form is no longer valid.
 Either events or types can be specified at a time. Example:

 types: "type1,type2,type3" // valid

 types: "*" // valid

 types: "*,type1" // invalid

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: scopes
directives.description:
Used to authorize access to a given query, mutation, or field
based on permissions set in the user token.
for example, to restrict a field foo to superadmins, add
  foo: Foo @scopes(scopes: ["superadmin"])
Permission strings must EXACTLY match the permission objects defined
in functional-permissions-lib. If the user does not have all required
permissions, the field will contain null and the errors list will
have an "access denied" error message.

args.name: scopes
args.description: List of one or more scopes required for the field

args.name: require
args.description:
Whether or not to require _all_ scopes listed or only any one of them.
Default is All.

directives.name: auth
directives.description:
Used to require authentication and to enforce organization-level
authorization. This directive, with default parameters, is applied by
default to all queries and mutations. Parameter values can be overridden
by setting it explicitly on a field.
The @noAuth directive can be explicitly used on fields that do not
require authentication.
Examples:
 Allow org-less tokens to access objects of type TemporalDataObject
 based on the id parameter.
  @auth(allowOrgless: true, objectAuthType: TemporalDataObject)
Allow org-less tokens to use the field with no object restrictions.
The @scopes directive might still apply.
  @auth(allowOrgless: true, skipObjectAuthorization: true)
Allow org-less tokens to use the field if the ID referenced in parentId
is in the allowed set of TemporalDataObjects. Useful for something like
createAsset.
  @auth(allowOrgless: true, objectAuthType: TemporalDataObject,
        objectAuthIdParam: parentId)

args.name: allowOrgless
args.description: Whether or not to allow access for org-less (engine) tokens

args.name: skipObjectAuthorization
args.description:
Whether or not to skip object-level authorization for org-less tokens.
Use with caution.

args.name: objectAuthType
args.description:
The type of object that object-level access controls should apply to.
Must be set if allowOrgless is true and skipObjectAuthorization is false.

args.name: objectAuthIdParam
args.description:
The name of the field parameter containing id(s) to query for.
Object-level authorization will authorize this value against the list of
allowed object resources for the token.

directives.name: noAuth
directives.description:
Used to explicitly declare that a given field does not require authentication.
Use with caution.

args.name: defaultValue
args.description:
default value for the feature flag to use if it is not provided
in configuration or on the org

args.name: name
args.description:
Optional name for the feature flag. The default will be the
mutation, query, or field name to which the directive is attached.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
